explanation: DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR, IT CAME TO THE ATTENTION OF MANAGEMENT THAT $40,000 HAD BEEN PAID TO A THIRD PARTY DUE TO A FALSE INVOICE. THREE LAYERS OF APPROVAL HAVE BEEN ADDED TO THE CONTROLS TO ENSURE A TRANSACTION LIKE THIS DOES NOT OCCUR AGAIN.
THE ORGANIZATION IS IN THE PROCESS OF LIQUIDATING. THE MAJORITY OF ASSETS WERE SOLD AND DISTRIBUTIONS WERE MADE TO TWO NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.

IWPR WIRED FUNDS TO SOMEONE BASED ON AN EMAIL THAT APPEARED TO BE FROM HEIDI HARTMANN, PRESIDENT, BUT HER EMAIL WAS COMPROMISED AND SHE WAS EITHER HACKED OR SPOOFED BY SOMEONE UNKNOWN TO THE ORGANIZATION. THE WIRE WAS FOR $12,500 OF WHICH IWPR RECOVERED $2,500 FROM THEIR INSURANCE COMPANY. THE BANK WAS IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED, AT LAST REPORT LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES ARE STILL INVESTIGATING THE THEFT.
At regular board meetings.

DURING THE 2015 FISCAL YEAR, THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AWARE THAT ITS TREASURER, ALBERT MELIN, HAD DIVERTED A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF CASH FOR HIS PERSONAL USE BEGINNING IN LATE 2013. THE AMOUNT OF THEFT TOTALED 292,201 IN THE 2013 FISCAL YEAR, 582,251 IN THE 2014 FISCAL YEAR AND 276,750 IN THE 2015 FISCAL YEAR. THE THEFT WAS DISCOVERED THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S REVIEW OF ITS FINANCIAL RECORDS AFTER A NEIGHBORING FIRE DEPARTMENT EXPERIENCED A SIMILAR ISSUE. ALL STOLEN FUNDS WERE RECOVERED DURING FISCAL YEAR 2016 VIA INSURANCE REIMBURSEMENT.

address: C/O PEGGY KUSER CPA 916 CENTRAL AVE
explanation: Organization became aware of director overstating travel expenses

DURING THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2016 THERE WAS UNAUTHORIZED USE OF THE ORGANIZATIONS CASH IN THE AMOUNT OF 42,638. THE PERSON IS NO LONGER WITH THE ORGANIZATION AND HAS MADE FULL RESTITUTION OF THE AMOUNT THAT WAS TAKEN.

bus_name: LEBANON AREA BOYS & GIRLS CLUB INC
explanation: DURING 2017, THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AWARE OF A MATERIAL DIVERSION OF ITS ASSETS IN 2016 THAT INVOLVED A FORMER EMPLOYEE OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE THEFT WAS DISCOVERED AFTER THE EMPLOYEE QUIT. WHILE THE EXACT AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL IMPACT HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED FOR 2016, AN INITIAL INVESTIGATION BY THE ORGANIZATION DETERMINED THAT AMOUNT WAS IN EXCESS OF $25,000. THE ORGANIZATION IS PURSUING CRIMINAL CHARGES AND EXPECTS TO RECEIVE AN INSURANCE SETTLEMENT IF THE INDIVIDUAL IS CONVICTED.

IN JANUARY 2016, THE ASSOCIATION NOTED CERTAIN ASSETS WERE MISAPPROPRIATED. AFTER A REVEIW OF THE TRANSACTIONS THE ASSOCIATION BELIEVES THAT $310,049 OF ASSETS WERE MISAPPROPRIATED. THIS MISAPPROPRIATON WAS REPORTED TO THE PROPER LEGAL AUTHORITIES. IN DECEMBER 2016 THE ASSOCIATION RECEIVED $311,472 FROM THEIR INSURER FOR THE LOSSES. THE INSURANCE PROCEEDS ARE ACCOUNTED AS REVENUE IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES IN THE YEAR ENDING DECEMBER 31, 2016 AND HAS DESIGNATED THESE FUNDS AS A CREDIT BACK TO ITS MEMBERS IN 2017.

bus_name: RED BRICK COUNCIL FOR THE ARTS
explanation: THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AWARE OF FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY IN JUNE 2017 THAT BEGAN IN PRIOR YEARS. MOST OF THE FUNDS WERE TAKEN FROM AN ACCOUNT MANAGED BY THE ORGAINIZATION ON BEHALF OF THE CITY OF ASPEN.

bus_name: GOTHAM GIRLS ROLLER DERBY NFP LTD
Western Howard County Youth Basketball Assn Inc
explanation: During the year, the email address of the President was hacked. Emails were sent to the Treasurer requesting payment be mailed for approved expenses. $25,000 was wired to a third party. The police were contacted and an investigation was conducted, but the funds were unable to be recovered.

bus_name: TREASURE VALLEY LODGE 11 FRATERNAL ORDER OF POLICE
CHILD EVANGELISM FELLOWSHIP INC NORTH CAROLINA CHAPTER
explanation: IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE TREASURER OF ONE OF THE CHAPTERS HAD DIVERTED FUNDS TO HER PERSONAL USE FROM 2010 UNTIL 2016 IN THE AMOUNT OF 64,080. SHE HAS BEEN REMOVED AS TREASURER OF THAT CHAPTER AND PROCEDURES HAVE BEEN PUT IN PLACE SO THAT ALL INVOICES ARE APPROVED BY THE CHAPTER PRESIDENT ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IT IS ALSO REQUIRED THAT THE BANK STATEMENTS AND BANK RECONCILIATIONS BE PROVIDED TO EACH CHAPTER'S COMMITTEE EACH MONTH TO BE REVIEWED. ALL CHAPTERS MUST HAVE A YEARLY FINANCIAL REVIEW PERFORMED BY A PERSON OUTSIDE THE MINISTRY. THE STATE OFFICE AND TREASURER ALSO NOW HAS ACCESS TO ALL CHAPTERS BANK ACCOUNTS. AS OF THE FILING OF THIS RETURN, THE FUNDS HAVE BEEN REPAID BY THAT INDIVIDUAL.

bus_name: American Friends of the Israel Sport Center for the Disabled
explanation: IN SEPTEMBER 2016, THE ORGANIZATION DISCOVERED THAT ITS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, WHO LEFT THE ORGANIZATION ON AUGUST 1, 2016, HAD ALLEGEDLY COMMITTED FRAUD BY MISAPPROPRIATING FUNDS FROM THE INCEPTION OF THE ORGANIZATION IN FEBRUARY 2011 THROUGH AUGUST 1, 2016. See Schedule L for additional information regarding this issue.

bus_name: The US Council for International Business INCORPORATED
explanation: In October 2017, the Council received an insurance settlement of $1,000,000 for a claim of loss relating to the fraudulent activity of its former CFO. The settlement amount represented the maximum limit under the insurance policy. In February 2016, the Council discovered that its then CFO appeared to have misappropriated funds from USCIB to use for his personal benefit. The Council hired outside legal counsel and forensic auditors to conduct an internal investigation into the suspicious activity, and terminated the former CFO in March of 2016. During the internal investigation, USCIB learned about a criminal investigation that the federal government and IRS was conducting of the former CFO. In May 2017, the former CFO plead guilty to wire fraud and tax fraud, and USCIB was named as a victim of his crimes. As part of the guilty plea, the former CFO admitted that his crime involved misappropriation of assets from USCIB in the amount of $1,347,259. In addition to the criminal theft, the former CFO agreed to pay an additional $400,000 to USCIB due to amounts of organizational money he used for his personal benefit for which he never reimbursed USCIB. At the former CFO's sentencing in October 2017, he was ordered to repay USCIB as restitution more than 1.3 million.

DURING 2016 IT WAS DISCOVERD THAT THERE WERE APPROXIMATELY $11,000 IN UNAUTHORIZED EXPENDITURES WHICH WERE UNRELATED TO BOUNCE ANIMAL RESCUE. LEGAL ACTION AGAINST THE PERSON FOR THE ALLEGED UNAUTHORIZED EXPENDITURES WAS TAKEN AND A SETTLEMENT WAS REACHED FOR THE MONIES TO BE PAID BACK OVER A PERIOD OF 14 MONTHS. THE MONTHLY REPAYMENT INSTALLMENTS STARTED IN MAY 2017. THE INDIVIDUAL IS NO LONGER ASSOCIATED WITH BOUNCE ANIMAL RESCUE.

address: PLAZA II RARITAN CTR PO BOX 7818
explanation: In December 2016 the Board of Trustees became aware of certain actions of the Fund Administrator that the Trustees considered a breach of fiduciary duty and self-dealing. The Trustees have asserted, on behalf of this organization and the related Northeast Carpenters Pension and Annuity Plan, estimated losses (including interest) of over $3 million.

THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED REIMBURSED FUNDS TOTALING $218,000 THAT WERE RECEIVED BY AN OFFICER IN A PREVIOUS YEAR. $70,594 OF THE AMOUNT WAS ACCRUED AS A RECEIVABLE IN 2015, THE REMAINNING $147,406 WAS INCLUDED IN OTHER INCOME OF THE CURRENT YEAR.

EMPLOYEE WAS FRAUDULENTLY ISSUING CHECKS TO HERSELF AND MANIPULATING THE ACCOUNTING RECORDS TO AVOID DETECTION. CHARGES WERE FILED AGAINST THE EMPLOYEE AND A CLAIM WAS FILED WITH OUR INSURANCE CARRIER. ADDITIONAL ACCOUNTING CONTROLS WERE IMPLEMENTED REGARDING THE SEGREGATION OF DUTIES AND THE AUTHORITY TO AUTHORIZE CHECKS. INSURANCE PROCEEDS WERE RECEIVED IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 WITH $24,611 RELATED TO CURRENT YEAR FRAUDULENT ACTIVITIES AND $75,389 RELATED TO PRIOR YEARS.

The Organization's Business Manager embezzled in excess of $88,000 during calendar year 2016. A forensics audit determined the embezzlement had been ongoing since 2015. To date the Organization has determined the total loss to approximate $155,000.

bus_name: RAY OF HOPE MEDICAL MISSIONS INC
explanation: Dollar amounts involved: 39000 | Explain the nature of the diversion: After a 2 year business relationship with Sanyu Foundation located in Uganda, E. Africa we discovered that our Ugandan liaison deceptively diverted funds intended for the building of a medical clinic for his families own personal gain. He provided inflated quotations of goods and services in order to receive excess funds from Ray of Hope in which he had misappropriated. Upon discovery and investigation, we have concluded that the misappropriation of funds took place from Feb 2016-Aug 2016. | Other property involved: Land, vehicle and a partially built medical center were secured to Ray of Hope with the intervention of the local authorities. Building materials, equipment, office supplies and a motorbike were stolen by the offending liaison and never retrieved. | Corrective actions taken to address the matter: Land deeds, truck and building were secured Severed the relationship with Sanyu Foundation and all affiliates Stopped construction and withheld any monies Filed evidence with the local authorities, which led to fraud and theft charges being filed by the Institution of Kooki An MOU is in place with the Institution detailing expectations and use of funds received Ray of Hope now conducts all major business transactions in-country by sending an officer to represent ROHMM | Pertinent Circumstances: Too much leniency was given to our in-country liaison We did not appreciate how easily money could tempt and corrupt a person/organization All evidence is kept with ROH's legal papers for persons to review
At regular board meetings.

bus_name: Greater Cincinnati Intergroup Council of AA
explanation: In April 2015, taxpayer discovered an embezzlement of approximately $170,000 perpetrated by the now former office manager. Law enforcement was contacted and forensic accountants were hired. The perpetrator began making restitution during 2015. Taxpayer expects restitution to continue in the future. There is risk that the entire absconded amount may not be fully recovered.

bus_name: LOCAL UNION 1260 OF THE INT'L BROTHERHOOD OF ELECTRICAL WORKERS
explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS BEING INVESTIGATED BY SEVERAL FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES TO DETERMINE IF PRIOR MANAGEMENT ACTED INAPPROPRIATELY AND IF THERE WAS A DIVERSION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ASSETS. THE INVESTIGATION IS ONGOING AND NO FINDINGS HAVE BEEN REVEALED TODATE.

During 2016, PSI became aware of significant diversions of assets totaling $822,151 in different instances across various countries, which included $543,626 of theft by third parties and $278,525 of diversions involving PSI employees. PSI operates in challenging operating environments and while PSI implements necessary controls and security to secure the assets under our control in these instances conflicts in the operating countries meant we were unable to secure the assets against looting and theft. PSI also has established internal controls to guard against internal diversions of assets, but in 2016 there were instances where controls were overridden and losses occurred. For all instances reported, PSI performed investigations to determine the extent of the issue, reported the value to any funders whose activities were impacted by the diversions, ensured that funds were returned from other sources, and identified improvements to internal controls to reduce the risk of similar occurrences in the future.
NO

DURING 2016 THERE WERE VARIOUS THEFTS WHICH AMOUNTED TO A SIGNIFICANT DIVERSION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ASSETS. THE GROSS AMOUNT OF ASSETS DIVERTED TOTALED $39,463 DURING THE YEAR. HOWEVER, $37,562 OF THOSE ASSETS WERE SUBSEQUENTLY RECOVERED. THE EVENTS INCLUDE THE LOSS OF CONCESSION RECEIPTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $501, THE THEFT OF AN OFFICE SAFE HOLDING $1,400, AND FORGED CHECKS TOTALING $37,562. THE ORGANIZATION, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF ITS BANK, WAS ABLE TO DISCOVER AND RECOVER THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE FORGED CHECKS. THE BOARD HAS DISCUSSED VARIOUS METHODS TO FURTHER SAFEGUARD THE ORGANIZATION'S ASSETS, AND SECURITY MEASURES HAVE BEEN PUT IN PLACE. THOSE MEASURES INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF ADDITIONAL SECURITY CAMERAS WITH EXPANDED COVERAGE OF AREAS WHERE MONEY IS HANDLED, AND THE EXPLORATION OF NON-CHECK PAYMENT METHODS, INCLUDING WIRE TRANSFERS AND POSITIVE PAY LISTINGS WITH THE BANK.

bus_name: HOME BUILDER'S ASSOCIATION OF ST JOSEPH VALLEY INC
explanation: IN EARLY 2016, THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AWARE OF AN EMPLOYEE WHO EMBEZZLED ROUGHLY $10,000 IN FUNDS. THE EMPLOYEE HAS BEEN TERMINATED AND IS WORKING ON REPAYING $4,600 BACK TO THE ORGANIZATION. $5,400 HAS BEEN RECEIVED FROM THE ORGANIZATION'S INSURANCE COMPANY.

DURING THE 2016 YEAR IT WAS DETERMINED THAT SOMEONE IN THE ORGANIZATION MISAPPROPRIATED CASH IN THE AMOUNT OF $35,250. INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES IN PLACE AT THE TIME WERE DETERMINED TO NOT BE SUFFICIENT. MORE STRINGENT INTERNAL CONTROLS WERE ESTABLISHED IN REGARD TO CASH TRANSACTIONS, DAILY DEPOSITS, MONTHLY RECONCILIATIONS AND MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES CONTROLS IN PLACE NOW ARE SUFFICIENT.

bus_name: PROJECT VETCARE INC C/O SYNCHRONY ADVISORS LLC
explanation: THE NEW HAMPSHIRE CHARITABLE TRUSTS UNIT OPENED AN INVESTIGATION IN MARCH 2016 INTO THE USE OF FUNDS AT PROJECT VETCARE, INC. THIS INVESTIGATION RESULTED IN FINDINGS OF EMBEZZLEMENT AND FUNDS USED FOR PERSONAL NEEDS IN EXCESS OF $150,000. THE RECEIVER APPOINTED BY THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE'S CHARITABLE TRUST UNIT WILL OVERSEE THE DISSOLUTION OF THIS ORGANIZATION IN 2017 AND TRANSFER OF REMAINING ASSETS TO ANOTHER TAX EXEMPT ENTITY.

REGRETTABLY IN LATE OCTOBER 2017 IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT AN EMPLOYEE HAD ENGAGED IN SIGNIFICANT INSTANCES OF EMBEZZLEMENT AND EMPLOYEE THEFT FROM DECEMBER 2015 UNTIL OCTOBER 2017. IT HAS BEEN DETERMINED THAT THE SAID EMPLOYEE ALLEGEDLY STOLE OVER 220,000 FROM THE ORGANIZATION. THE ORGANIZATION IS TAKING THE FOLLOWING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS: THERE WAS A FIVE YEAR LOOK BACK ON ALL CHECKING ACCOUNTS, THE ORGANIZATION IS LOOKING TO OUTSOURCE THE BOOKKEEPING, AN AUDIT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S RECORDS WILL BE PERFORMED, IMPROVED OVERSIGHT PROCEDURES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AND SEEKING RECOVERY THROUGH RESTITUTION OR INSURANCE CLAIM.

Undocumented and unauthorized gift card usage in the amount of $72,886 was discovered by current officers. The Organization has since hired a new director and adopted policies, procedures and internal controls to deter future occurrences.
THE ORGANIZATION BECAME AWARE OF A DIVERSION OF ASSETS DURING 2016. THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON'S EMPLOYMENT WAS TERMINATED AND INTERNAL CONTROLS MODIFIED TO PREVENT SUCH DIVERSIONS.

IN JULY 2016, WE DISCOVERED EMPLOYEE FRAUD RESULTING IN THE THEFT OF MONEY THROUGH ISSUANCE OF A FALSIFIED CHECKS, THEFT OF CHECKS INTENDED FOR THE ORGANIZATION, AND FRAUDULENT RECORD KEEPING. ROUGHLY $600,000 WAS DIVERTED. ALONG WITH THIRD-PARTY PROFESSIONAL ADVISERS FAMILIAR WITH NON-PROFIT FRAUD, THE ORGANIZATION HAS COMPLETELY RESTRUCTURED ITS FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING SEGMENTING ACCOUNTING DUTIES, ADDING SIGNATURE AUTHORITY POLICIES ON ALL ACCOUNTS, CREATING A FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND ADOPTING FISCAL BEST-PRACTICES. THE LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY HAS INVESTIGATED THE INCIDENT AND THE EMPLOYEE IS EXPECTED TO BE FORMALLY CHARGED THIS YEAR. SOME OF THE LOST ASSETS HAVE BEEN RECOVERED THROUGH INSURANCE. WE ESTIMATE THAT ADDITIONAL ASSETS WILL BE RECOVERED THROUGH RESTITUTION, AND WE HAVE INITIATED A CIVIL LAWSUIT AGAINST A BANKING INSTITUTION WE BELIEVE WAS NEGLIGENT IN HONORING FRAUDULENT CHECKS.

APPROXIMATELY $15,000 IN FUNDS WERE DIVERTED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S RECEPTIONIST IN 2016. THE THEFT WAS DISCOVERED IN MARCH 2016 AND INSURANCE REIMBUSED THE ORGANIZATION IN JULY 2016. THE RECEPTIONIST IS IN THE COURT SYSTEM BEING PROSECUTED BY THE INSURANCE COMPANY.
